Title: Decades later, Karen de Boer still remembers a kind gesture from her college hallmate
Description:
As a college freshman, Karen de Boer was sometimes inconsiderate to her hallmate, Pam.
So when Karen missed the bus to her choir performance, she was surprised — and moved — when Pam came to her rescue.

Title: In effort to protect children, France bans smoking at parks and beaches
Description: Smokers are no longer allowed to light up in public parks, at swimming pools, or at beaches, or "anywhere children may be present," said French health and family minister Catherine Vautrin.

Title: 80 years later, a Holocaust survivor meets an American soldier who helped free him
Description:
Andrew Roth survived the Nazi concentration camp Buchenwald.
Jack Moran helped liberate the camp while serving in the U.S.
Army.
Decades after liberation, the two met and shared their stories.

Title: The best support for a friend with cancer? Presence, listening and space to vent
Description:
People who get cancer say their friends often disappear when they hear the bad news.
Don't be that person! Here's advice for what to do and say — and what not to say — when a loved one faces cancer.

Title: FTSE 100 LIVE: Markets higher as US-UK trade deal comes into force
Description: The deal lays out rules for imports and exports of cars and aerospace parts, reducing levies.

Title: Why Boosting U.S. Manufacturing Hinges More on Training and Technology Than Tariffs
Description: Although onshoring has its positives, after decades of predominantly offshoring, it is not a simple task to bring factories back stateside.

Description:

Title: Why Is ICE Masked Up?
Description: ICE agents in plainclothes pose a danger to civilians—and potentially to agents themselves.

Title: Trump admin live updates: Senate to begin 'One Big Beautiful Bill' vote-a-rama Monday
Description:
The Senate will begin its "vote-a-rama" at 9 a.m.
Monday, during which time senators will offer amendments to the "One Big Beautiful Bill."

Title: “Jubilee,” by Jhumpa Lahiri
Description: Fiction by Jhumpa Lahiri, the author of “Roman Stories” and “The Namesake”: I was simply happy to inhabit my birthplace, my janmasthan: this almost unbearably meaningful fact that linked me to every red letter box and double-decker bus.

Title: Ask HN: Is the header CSS broken for you?
Entry-level jobs down by a third since launch of ChatGPT
Description: Entry-level opportunities have taken a significant hit, dropping by nearly a third since the advent of widely available generative AI tools at the end of 2022.

Title: Why Did the Company behind the Dakota Access Pipeline Sue Greenpeace?
Description: Energy Transfer, the company behind the Dakota Access Pipeline, sued the nonprofit Greenpeace over alleged conspiracy—the host of Drilled explains why

Title: Cells Can ‘Hear’ Sounds—And Respond Genetically
Description: Audible sound can affect gene activity in mouse cells, boosting the attachment of muscle precursors to surrounding tissue and decreasing fat accumulation

Title: Closing day for Towne West: a look back at how it started, what went wrong
Description:
